bibl.title: Hazzard v. Aguirre and Price. Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holidng terms at Tacoma in and for the County of Pierce.
-------------------------------- : The Territory of Washington on the: relation of George Hazzard, : : vs. : HABEUS CORPUS. James H. Price and M.G. Aguirre. : : -------------------------------
And now come the petitioner George Hazzard in his own proper person as well as by his counsel and for answer unto the return of James H. Price and M.G. Aguirre herein filed says:

That the warrant issued by the Governor of Washington Territory on the 5th day of October 1889 in the return of the defendants mentioned, and uner and by virtue of which the defendants attempt to justify the restraint and detention of the petitioner, is insufficient in law to justify or authorize such restraint or detention of the petitioner.

And the said petitioner further answering says, that the only authority, reason, or ground for issuing the "said warrant by the Governor of Washington Territory, in the return of the defendants mentioned, was the presentation to him of certain papers by the Governor of the State of California now o file in the office of the Governor of the Territory of Washington, duly certified copies whereof are herewith filed marked Exhibit "A", and made part of this answer.
